turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking at my latest bill and there's a charge for $75 that I don't recognize at all. It says 'Service Upgrade Fee' but I didn't upgrade anything! What is this for?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I understand you have a question about a charge on your bill. I can definitely look into this for you. Could you please provide your account number or the email address associated with your service so I can access your billing details?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my email is [user's email here]. But seriously, I'm pretty annoyed. I'm on a fixed plan, I haven't made any changes or clicked any upgrade buttons. How could this charge even appear? Are you telling me I was automatically upgraded and now have to pay? That doesn't seem right at all.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing your email address. I've accessed your account. The 'Service Upgrade Fee' typically applies when a user opts into a feature or service tier that is not part of their standard package. While automatic upgrades without consent should not occur, sometimes trial periods or specific feature accesses can trigger a charge if not cancelled within a certain timeframe. I can see the charge posted on [Date]. To determine the exact cause and explore options like a credit, I would need to initiate a formal billing investigation which can take 3-5 business days. Would you like me to start that process?
